poem:
### Oligarchs in the North Sea

Two shadowed names in ink and greed,
The North Sea's veins begin to bleed.
Sanctioned hands stroke gold's warm hue,
Darkened tides and fortunes brew.
From Aberdeen to Kremlin walls,
Echoes of distant money calls—
Oligarchs drift on oil-slicked waves,
A nation's trust, another's graves.
